name: Extension
title: CS Extension
notes:
**Note 1**:  This AJCC staging system applies only to pleural mesotheliomas. Peritoneal and pericardial mesotheliomas are not TNM staged.

**Note 2**:  Pleural effusion does not affect the coding of the CS Extension field, but is coded in CS Site-Specific Factor 1.
footnotes: - For CS Extension codes 120-999, the assignment of Summary Stage 1977 and Summary Stage 2000 depends on the value of CS Site-Specific Factor 1, Pleural Effusion, as shown in the Extension Pleural Effusion Table for this schema.
rows:
OBSOLETE DATA CONVERTED V0200
See code 160

Invasive tumor (mesothelioma) confined to pleura, NOS

Ipsilateral parietal pleura, including mediastinal or diaphragmatic pleura, 
WITHOUT involvement of visceral pleura

Stated as T1a with no other information on extension

Ipsilateral parietal pleura, including mediastinal or diaphragmatic pleura,
WITH focal involvement of visceral pleura

Stated as T1b with no other information on extension

Invasive tumor (mesothelioma) confined to pleura, NOS 
Ipsilateral parietal pleura, including mediastinal or diaphragmatic pleura, involvement of visceral pleura not stated
Stated as T1 [NOS] with no other information on extension

Ipsilateral pleura WITH nodule(s) beneath visceral pleural surface
Ipsilateral pleural surface with confluent visceral pleural tumor (including fissure)

OBSOLETE DATA RETAINED AND REVIEWED V0203
See codes 170, 305

Localized, NOS 
Stated as T1, NOS with no other information on extension

Mesothelioma nodule(s) which have broken through the visceral pleural surface to the lung surface
Lung parenchyma, or lung involvement, NOS
Stated as T2 with no other information on extension

Adjacent connective tissue:
    Pericardium, non-transmural or NOS
    Endothoracic fascia

Chest wall, solitary focus of tumor ONLY
Mediastinal tissues, mediastinal fat
Stated as T3 with no other information on extension

Diffuse or multifocal invasion of soft tissues of chest wall
Heart muscle, myocardium
Mediastinal organs
Rib
Extension to internal surface of pericardium

Contralateral pleura
(For contralateral lung, see CS Mets at DX)

Further contiguous extension:
    Brachial plexus
    Cervical tissues
    Intra-abdominal organs
    Peritoneum
    Spine
Stated as T4 with no other information on extension

Unknown; extension not stated
Primary tumor cannot be assessed
Not documented in patient record
